item.title: Apache Parquet exploit tool detect servers vulnerable to critical flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A proof-of-concept exploit tool has been publicly released for a maximum severity Apache Parquet vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-30065, making it easy to find vulnerable servers. [...]

item.title: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server RCE flaw now exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are exploiting an unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server to hijack devices and deploy malware. [...]

item.title: UK Legal Aid Agency investigates cybersecurity incident
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Legal Aid Agency (LAA), an executive agency of the UK's Ministry of Justice that oversees billions in legal funding, warned law firms of a security incident and said the attackers might have accessed financial information. [...]

item.title: Critical Langflow RCE flaw exploited to hack AI app servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has tagged a Langflow remote code execution vulnerability as actively exploited, urging organizations to apply security updates and mitigations as soon as possible. [...]

item.title: New Microsoft 365 outage impacts Teams and other services
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating a new Microsoft 365 outage affecting multiple services across North America, including the company's Teams collaboration platform. [...]

item.title: Why EASM is vital to modern digital risk protection
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Outpost24
item.description: You can't protect what you can't see. From shadow IT to supplier risk, modern attack surfaces are sprawling fast — and External Attack Surface Management (EASM) is how security teams take back control. Learn from Outpost24 how EASM powers proactive digital risk protection. [...]

item.title: Google fixes actively exploited FreeType flaw on Android
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google has released the May 2025 security updates for Android with fixes for 45 security flaws, including an actively exploited zero-click FreeType 2 code execution vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Microsoft unveils new AI agents that can modify Windows settings
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Today, Microsoft announced new Windows experiences for Copilot+ PCs, including AI agents that will make changing settings on your Windows computer easier. [...]

item.title: Linux wiper malware hidden in malicious Go modules on GitHub
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A supply-chain attack targets Linux servers with disk-wiping malware hidden in Golang modules published on GitHub. [...]

item.title: Microsoft pushes fix for Windows 11 24H2 update failures
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue preventing Windows 11 24H2 feature updates from being delivered via Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) after installing the April 2025 security updates. [...]

item.title: Luna Moth extortion hackers pose as IT help desks to breach US firms
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The data-theft extortion group known as Luna Moth, aka Silent Ransom Group, has ramped up callback phishing campaigns in attacks on legal and financial institutions in the United States. [...]

item.title: New "Bring Your Own Installer" EDR bypass used in ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A new "Bring Your Own Installer" EDR bypass technique is exploited in attacks to bypass SentinelOne's tamper protection feature, allowing threat actors to disable endpoint detection and response (EDR) agents to install the Babuk ransomware. [...]

item.title: Microsoft finds default Kubernetes Helm charts can expose data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft warns about the security risks posed by default configurations in Kubernetes deployments, particularly those using out-of-the-box Helm charts, which could publicly expose sensitive data. [...]
